name: Epigenomic
description: Epigenetics the study of the chemical modification of specific genes or gene-associated proteins of an organism  (e.g. methylation and histone modification). Includes Epigenomics - The study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.; http://edamontology.org/topic_3295

name: Genomic
description: The branch of biology that deals with heredity, especially the mechanisms of hereditary transmission and the variation of inherited characteristics among similar or related organisms. Includes Genomics - The study of comprehensive sets of genes via high throughput methods.e.g.  sequence analysis and assemblies; http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C16624

name: Metagenomic
description: genetic and genomic data from environmental samples

name: Transcriptomic
description: The analysis of transcriptomes, or a set of all the RNA molecules in a specific organism, tissue, cell etc.; http://edamontology.org/topic_3308

name: Workflow
description: The sequence of steps involved in moving from the beginning to the end of a biological or biomedical analytical workflow or pipeline; http://edamontology.org/topic_0769

name: Software
description: The application of a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach to the development, operation, and maintenance of computer software, e.g. computational tools for analysing and managing biological data; http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C17147

name: Imaging
description: The visual representation of an object. This includes diffraction experiments that are based upon the interference of waves, typically electromagnetic waves such as X-rays or visible light, by some object being studied, typical in order to produce an image of the object or determine its structure;  http://edamontology.org/topic_3382

name: Proteomic
description: The global analysis of cellular proteins. Proteomics uses a combination of sophisticated techniques including two-dimensional (2D) gel electrophoresis, image analysis, mass spectrometry, amino acid sequencing, and bio-informatics to resolve comprehensively, to quantify, and to characterize proteins; http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C20085

name: Neuroscience
description: A subject domain encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to the brain and nervous system; http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C95096

name: Network-Analysis
description: Data relating to network-analysis studies, either the results of network analysis or the methods.

name: Electrophysiology
description: Data relating to the flow of ions (ion current) in biological tissues and, in particular, to the electrical recording techniques that enable the measurement of this flow.
